Name: positive
Label: Positive
Definition: For a binary/trinary cell phenotype criterion, the presence or most-abundance indicator.

Name: negative
Label: Negative
Definition: For a binary/trinary cell phenotype criterion, the absence or least-abundance indicator.

Name: low
Label: Low
Definition: For a trinary cell phenotype criterion, the intermediate value.

Name: immunohistochemistry
Label: Immunohistochemistry
Definition: An immunostaining assay to detect and potentially localize antigens within the cells of a tissue section.

Name: immunofluorescence
Label: Immunofluorescence
Definition: A marking system in which the antibody is conjugated to a fluorophore, the latter rendered observable by active imaging, the process consisting of excitation of the specimen and observation of emission at specific wavelengths.

Name: multiplexed_immunohistochemistry
Label: Multiplexed immunohistochemistry
Definition: Immunohistochemistry in which a special procedure is used to allow simultaneous or sequential staining on the same specimen.

Name: multiplexed_immunofluorescence
Label: Multiplexed immunofluorescence
Definition: Immunofluorescence in which a special procedure is used to allow simultaneous or sequential staining on the same specimen.

Name: in_situ_hybridization
Label: In situ hybridization
Definition: An assay that localizes a specific DNA or RNA sequence within a portion or section of tissue using artificially induced nucleic hybridization.

Name: fluorescence_in_situ_hybridization
Label: Fluorescence in situ hybridization
Definition: An in-situ hybridization assay in which fluorescently labeled molecules are used to localize specific DNA or RNA sequences.

Name: flow_cytometry
Label: Flow cytometry
Definition: A cytometry assay in which an input cell population is put in solution, is passed by a laser, and optical sensors are used to detect scattering of the laser light and/or fluorescence of specific markers to count and characterize the particles in solution.

Name: imaging_mass_cytometry
Label: Imaging mass cytometry
Definition: A cytometry time of flight assay in which molecules of interest on or in cells are imaged through a system in which samples are labeled with multiple different rare-earth tagged antibodies. The sample is then ablated with a laser and the labeled material is detected by cytometry time of flight mass spectrometry.

Name: esri_shapefile_shp
Label: ESRI Shapefile SHP
Definition: ESRI Shapefile .shp portion, feature geometry. Often the contents should be a single point or a single closed polygon.

Name: portable_network_graphics_mask
Label: Portable network graphics mask
Definition: A Portable Network Graphics (PNG) file with 2-bit depth (monochrome). The 1 value indicates membership in the shape structure, and the 0 value indicates non-membership.
